POR.content: irrationalism, nihilism, posture completely symmetrical to, thus dependent on principle of reason [Leibniz denounced extravagance of irrationalism]
this is observed when those who defend principle of reason act w/out reason, w/ obscurantism and nihilism to defend reason

HASD.content: deconstruction: a “symptom” of modern/postmodern nihilism or last testimony of faith, martyrdom, in the present fin de siècle?
acc. Heidegger, nihilism: not taking seriously thought of nothing

VM.content: least violence is the avowal of violence (against nihilism); worst violence: nothingness, unimaginable night
for Heidegger, language’s dissimulation is the 1<sup><small>st</small></sup> violence, but also 1st defeat of nihilistic violence > 1<sup><small>st</small></sup> epiphany of Being

PAS.content: “singular materiality” of pas goes beyond nihilist impasse, and “materialist theses”

POOF.content: via Nietzsche, no longer any homes here, darkness falling on value of value, hence on the very desire for an axiomatic (a consistent, granted, presupposed system of values)

EL.content: “logic,” “program,” “nihilism” in quotation marks—give these words a gripping resemblance to their opposite

LI.content: relativism, and everything sometimes associated w/ it (skepticism, empiricism, even nihilism), remains a philosophical position in contradiction w/ itself (Husserl showed this better than anyone)
when a deconstructionist is dismissed as someone who has no regard for truth, and whose text therefore demands no rigor—deconstructionist is synonymous w/ skeptic-relativist-nihilist!

IF.content: via Flaubert, the devil is no more an atheist than Spinoza > no one is less atheist than devil
